lead_paragraph: Citigroup is moving from controlling damage to pursuing increased profits. Vikram S. Pandit, Citi’s chief executive, laid out ambitious targets for growth on Thursday afternoon, saying the bank’s return on assets should rise to 1.25 to 1.5 percent in the near future, from the current 1.15 percent. But the bank would not comment on when it would hit those goals or how it would deal with the billions of dollars of bad securities that remain as part of its Citi Holdings.

headline.main: Citigroup’s Chief Is Optimistic on Profit Growth
